alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ripley, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Manchester, Decatur, Russellville, Concord, Bentonville, Redoak, Trinity and Bradysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
